details.title: Prime Minister urges voters to break existing polling records
details.content:
Another phase of the General Elections begins today. I hope those voting today do so in large numbers and break the voting records of the previous three phases.

A special appeal to young voters to head to the polling booth and exercise their franchise.

— Chowkidar Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) April 29, 2019

details.title: Amidst heavy security, Bengal begins polling
details.content: Amidst heavy security, Bengal began polling for eighjt seats. The Election Commission has deployed 561 companies of central forces for ensure peaceful polling.

details.title: In Mumbai, veteran actor Rekha cast her vote
details.content:
#Mumbai: Veteran actor Rekha casts her vote at polling booth number 283 in Bandra. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/z14VraA06W

— ANI (@ANI) April 29, 2019

details.title: Polling delayed in Bengal
details.content: Voting is yet to begin at booth number 286/184 and 286/185 in Bolpur after a glitch in EVM was detected. (ANI)

details.title: Ravi Kishan waiting in queue to cast his ballot
details.content:
#Mumbai: BJP MP candidate from UP's Gorakhpur, Ravi Kishan waits in queue to cast his vote at a polling booth in Goregaon pic.twitter.com/Ji85dcyKNt

— ANI (@ANI) April 29, 2019

details.title: Maharashtra Saffron bastions up for crucial battle today
details.content:
All the 17 seats going to polls today belong to the BJP-Shiv Sena alliance and retaining them all would be the hardest challenge the twin parties face this time. Shiv Sena holds a whopping 9 of these 17 seats, while the BJP holds 8.

Mumbai Congress chief Milind Deora, actress Urmila Matondkar, Priya Dutt, Poonam Mahajan, Sharad Pawar’s grandson Parth Pawar and actor Dr Amol Kolhe are some of the interesting candidates in fray. (CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: In Begusarai, its Kanhaiya Kumar versus Union Minister Giriraj Singh
details.content:
Once a left bastion, Begusarai is witnessing a triangular fight between CPI's Kanhaiya Kumar, BJP's Giriraj Singh and RJD's  Tanveer Hassan.

In this welter of socialist, communist and liberal politics, new caste arithmetic and shrill-rightist nationalism have been inducted, besides the plea of a secular vote. This has made for a tough electoral battle for Union Minister Giriraj Singh of the BJP and Kanhaiya Kumar of the CPI.

details.title: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das casts his vote
details.content:
#Mumbai: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das casts his vote at polling booth number 40 & 41 at Peddar Road. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/i2TFjtuJxP

— ANI (@ANI) April 29, 2019

details.title: Kanpur a battle of prestige; Unnao set for triangular contest with edge to Congress
details.content:
People in Unnao don’t shy in airing their dejection for BJP’s Sakshi Maharaj who is seeking re-election from here. However, they vow to vote for Modi on the issue of nationalism.

Although Kanpur is not a VIP seat, people there too are giving out a mixed bag of reactions laced with ambiguity. 

READ here

details.title: Paresh Rawal cast his vote in Vile Parle
Repeating 2014 result in Rajasthan will be tall order for BJP
details.content:
In 2014, Rajasthan was among the few states swept completely by the BJP, which won all the 25 seats. But the loss in the recent Vidhan Sabha polls has made it a challenge for the BJP to save its bastions.

This time, the 4,86,03,329 voters, 56,08,672 more than the number during the 2014 Lok Sabha polls, will decide the fortunes of the BJP and the Congress. Will BJP manage to retain the state for a second term?

details.title: Polls staffs in MP die hours before polling
details.content: Two poll staff died hours before voting in Madhya Pradesh. 42-year-old college peon Amit who was part of team to Lakhnadaun (Mandla seat) died following brain heaemorrhage. In the evening. 50 year old Sunanda Kotekar died due to heart attack in Sausar assembly segment of Chhindwara.

details.title: Priyanka Chopra flew down to India to cast her ballot
details.content:
This is the moment that matters....  Every vote is a voice that counts. #LokSabhaElections2019 pic.twitter.com/L0AHJLL4uY

— PRIYANKA (@priyankachopra) April 29, 2019

details.title: It’s Maha test time for Raj Thackeray’s impact
details.content:
Known for his oratory and theatrics, Thackeray drew a lot of eyeballs by running a corporate style campaign using powerpoint presentations and videos to “expose the pompous claims of” Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP. The echo of his style on social media was several times louder.

He ignored Vidarbha and Marathwada and focused on West Maharashtra and the Mumbai Metropolitan Area, which is a Shiv Sena stronghold. For a party that has no presence even in a municipal corporation, this could be the MNS’ defining moment.

details.title: Technical glitch in EVM in Antop hill
details.content: Voting was halted in Mumbai's Antop hill following technical glitches in the electronic voting machine.

details.title: Poor poll turnout in Begusarai
details.content:
Polling in Begusarai started off on  a slow pace with just 6 per cent turnout till 9am. 

Compared to Begusarai, Munger,which is witnessing a tough battle between the wife of a don turned 3-time MLA contesting on the ticket of Congress and JDU leader, picked up the polling with above 4.5 per cent.

details.title: BJP candidate Poonam Mahajan casts vote with her family

details.title: Faulty EVMs delay voting in booths across 13 seats in UP
details.content: Reports of snags in EVMs have been pouring in from a number of booths across all the constituencies in UP leading to delay in voting. As per initial reports, EVMs developed snags at around 17 booths across Kannauj.

details.title: Madhuri Dixit Nene casts vote in Mumbai
No vote polled in 8 booths of Anantnag
details.content:
Out of 12 polling stations in Government Higher secondary Schoool in Qaimoh, Kulgam, no votes were polled in eight polling booths

. In four others, one or two votes were polled. Most of the polling stations were void of polling agents. Amidst tight security, stone pelting was reported from multiple areas.

details.content: EVMs at a few booths in Balasore and Jaipur Lok Sabha constituencies also developed snag causing resentment among voters.

Candidate alleges attack by Naxals, EC launches probe
details.content: An Independent candidate in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat Lok Sabha seat alleged that his vehicle was set afire by Naxals on Monday, officials said. (CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: India elections 2019: Fourth Phase of polls off to a slow start
Lok Sabha polls Phase 4: Three polling officers collapse to death in Madhya Pradesh
details.content: Three polling staff died in Madhya Pradesh just a few hours before voting commenced in six parliamentary constituencies and bypoll to one assembly seat.

details.title: Extremely poor voter turnout in Kulgam
details.content: Of total 4331 votes in five polling stations in Kulgam town in south Kashmir, 163 votes were polled till 11 am.

details.title: 28.67 per cent turnout recorded in MP
details.content: So far 28.67 per cent polling has been recorded in Madhya Pradesh.

details.title: Got bed tea late, unaware of violence: Moon Moon Sen
details.content: Asansol's TMC candidate actor-turned-politician Moon Sen while speaking to media said she is unaware of the violence because she woke up late. "They gave me my bed tea very late so I woke up very late. What can I say? I really don't know," Sen told NDTV.

details.title: Impressive voter turnout in Maharashtra's tribal constituencies
details.content: Of the four tribal constituencies, three are going for voting in the fourth phase. Nandurbar, Dindori and Palghar have all crossed the 20 per cent mark till 11 in the morning. Gadchiroli is the only other tribal constituency of the state that went for polling in the first phase of the election on April 11 and had registered maximum voting percentage in that phase.

details.title: Impressive voter turnout in Maharashtra's tribal constituencies
details.content: Of the four tribal constituencies, three are going for voting in the fourth phase. Nandurbar, Dindori and Palghar have all crossed the 20 per cent mark till 11 in the morning. Gadchiroli is the only other tribal constituency of the state that went for polling in the first phase of the election on April 11 and had registered maximum voting percentage in that phase.

Sanjay Sathe, the onion grower from Naitale in Niphad taluka of Nashik district executed his right to vote in the Dindori lok sabha constituency on Monday. Sathe is the farmer who had sent Rs 1063 he had received by selling off 750 kg of onion to the PMO by money order to protest falling onion prices.
[READ FULL STORY HERE]

TMC writes to EC over alleged "firing by Central Forces personnel inside a polling booth in Dubrajpur, Birbhum parliamentary constituency". Letter states, "Central forces have created a reign of terror in minds of voters & have also urged the voters to cast their vote for BJP." (ANI)

— ANI (@ANI) April 29, 2019
Kanpur District Magistrate Vijay Vishwas Pant and his wife after casting their vote

details.title: Deploy central forces in violence-hit Bengal: BJP
details.content:
The BJP Monday approached the Election Commission complaining that TMC workers have "hijacked democracy in the state" and again demanded deployment of central forces in all polling booths there.
A BJP delegation, which includes Union Ministers Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi and Vijay Goel, and the party's media in-charge Anil Baluni, met the top officials of the poll panel here and submitted a memorandum in this regard.
Madhya Pradesh records 55.14% polling on six Lok Sabha seats till 3 pm.  Sidhi: 48.85 Shahdol: 55.49 Jabalpur: 53.87 Balaghat: 60.18 Mandla: 55.61 Chhindwara: 59.87

details.title: TMC goons are not letting people vote: PM Modi
details.content: Goons of TMC are trying their hardest to stop people from voting and attacking BJP workers, they are not letting BJP leaders campaign, says PM in Bengal's Serampore.

53% voter turnout recorded in #Odisha till 3pm in the #FourthPhaseElection. Three polling officials placed under suspension for allegedly influencing voters#OdishaElections2019 #ElectionsWithTNIE @NewIndianXpress @Siba_TNIE

— Sudarsan Maharana (@Sud_TNIE) April 29, 2019

details.title: Voting percentage in Mumbai crosses city's temperature!
Central forces have created a 'reign of terror', TMC writes to EC
details.content:
The Trinamool Congress Monday approached the Election Commission alleging that the central forces deployed in West Bengal have created a "reign of terror" in the minds of voters and acted in a manner which is not conducive to free and fair elections. TMC leaders Shanta Chhetri and Chandan Mitra submitted two letters to the EC - one alleging illegal action taken by the forces as well as a violation of the model code of conduct by BJP candidates and the second related to firing by Central Forces personnel inside polling booths in Dubraipur and Birbhum Parliamentary constituency. 

READ FULL STORY HERE

details.title: FIR against Babul Supriyo for trespassing into polling booth
details.content:
Election Commission directs police to register FIR against Babul Supriyo, Union Minister & BJP candidate from Asansol LS seat, for allegedly trespassing into booth number 199 and threatening a polling agent and an officer.

details.title: Maha police detain dog with pro-BJP stickers on its body
details.content: A dog with pro-BJP stickers on its body, with message: "Modi Lao, Desh Bachao" (Vote for Modi and save the country), was detained along with his master in north Maharashtra's Nandurbar town for campaigning on polling day. (READ HERE)

details.title: Jaipur cardiologist cycles 80 km to cast his vote
details.content: A Jaipur-based cardiologist covered a distance of around 80 km on a cycle to cast his vote in Tonk-Sawaimadhopur Lok Sabha seat in Rajasthan on Monday."This was just to create awareness for polling and good health. It took me four hours to reach my village," he said. (READ HERE)
